title: Make video preview look realistic with cinematic quality

requirements.summary: Redesign the video preview area in VideoResultScreen to display a realistic, cinematic animated placeholder with film grain, color grading, scan-line effects, focus pulse, and letterbox framing, plus update the heading to 'Your Video is Ready' with a cinematic glow
acceptanceCriteria: The video preview area at the specified XPath shows a visually rich animated placeholder that resembles a real video playing (not a plain shimmer box)
The preview includes at least: a dark letterbox frame, animated color-grading gradient layers, film grain or scan-line texture, and a camera-focus pulse
The heading above the preview reads 'Your Video is Ready' and has a visible cinematic glow or text-shadow effect
All animations loop smoothly without flickering
The preview fills its container and maintains a 16:9 aspect ratio
The overall impression is of a high-quality, professionally generated video

file_operations.description: Replace the current animated placeholder div (at XPath /html[1]/body[1]/div[1]/div[1]/main[1]/div[1]/div[2]/div[1]) with a multi-layered cinematic video preview structure that includes: a container with 16:9 aspect ratio and black letterbox bars (top/bottom padding), a deep black base layer, a film grain texture overlay animated with the filmGrain animation, multiple gradient layers animated with colorGrade to simulate cinematic color toning (teal shadows to warm highlights), a scan-line effect layer animated with scanLine moving top to bottom, and a subtle focusPulse animation on the entire preview to simulate camera breathing. Update the heading element (at XPath /html[1]/body[1]/div[1]/div[1]/main[1]/div[1]/div[2]/h1[1]) to display 'Your Video is Ready' with a cinematic glow effect using text-shadow and gradient text. Add an 'HD' or resolution badge positioned in the top-right corner of the preview area. Ensure all layers use absolute positioning within a relative container and maintain proper z-index stacking. Apply Tailwind utility classes for the filmGrain, colorGrade, scanLine, and focusPulse animations (defined in REQ-28). Do not modify the download/share/generate-again buttons or metadata sections below the preview.

requirements.summary: Add CSS keyframe animations (filmGrain, colorGrade, scanLine, focusPulse) to support the realistic video preview effect and register them in Tailwind config
acceptanceCriteria: filmGrain, colorGrade, scanLine, and focusPulse keyframe animations are defined in index.css
Animations are registered in tailwind.config.js under theme.extend.keyframes and theme.extend.animation
Each animation loops indefinitely and runs at an appropriate speed (scanLine: 3s, colorGrade: 6s, focusPulse: 4s, filmGrain: 0.5s)
No existing animations are removed or broken

file_operations.description: Add four new @keyframes definitions to the existing stylesheet: (1) 'filmGrain' that randomly shifts a noise-like background-position to simulate film grain texture (0%: 0% 0%, 10%: -5% -10%, 20%: -15% 5%, etc., with varied positions throughout to create organic noise movement); (2) 'colorGrade' that transitions background gradients through cinematic color tones starting from deep teal/cyan shadows (0%), moving through neutral midtones (50%), to warm orange/amber highlights (100%) using linear-gradient stops; (3) 'scanLine' that moves a semi-transparent horizontal bar from top: -10% at 0% to top: 110% at 100% to simulate a scanning light pass; (4) 'focusPulse' that subtly scales an element from transform: scale(1.0) at 0% to scale(1.003) at 50% and back to scale(1.0) at 100% to mimic camera breathing/focus shift. Place these definitions in the global styles section, ensuring they do not conflict with existing keyframes like shimmer or videoScan.

Register the four new animations in the Tailwind configuration by extending theme.extend.keyframes with entries for 'filmGrain', 'colorGrade', 'scanLine', and 'focusPulse' (matching the @keyframes definitions added to index.css). Then add corresponding entries to theme.extend.animation: 'filmGrain': 'filmGrain 0.5s steps(10) infinite', 'colorGrade': 'colorGrade 6s ease-in-out infinite', 'scanLine': 'scanLine 3s linear infinite', 'focusPulse': 'focusPulse 4s ease-in-out infinite'. Ensure existing animations like shimmer and pulse-glow remain intact and functional.
